pullRequest.body:
We introduce polynomial evaluation using SMul, so polynomials can be evaluated at elements of non-associative semirings.  This is most useful in the power-associative context, but power-associativity is not implemented yet.

We obtain a generalization of `Polynomial.evalâ‚‚`, and in particular of the specializations `Polynomial.aeval` and `Polynomial.leval`.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Maybe it should be mentioned somewhere that this is a generalization of `Polynomial.leval` and `Polynomial.aeval`.
Could you add the correct compatibility lemmas for `leval` and `aeval`?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7659895677/job/20876020922)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7659895677/job/20876020511)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7659895677/job/20876020726)

This looks good! Thanks for this generalization.

Two minor comments.

I think that for rewriting purposes, the lemma is more useful if you state it on the level of (coerced) functions. Because then you can also rewrite backwards, to turn a `smeval` into a `leval` when that is possible/useful.
Thank you.  This would not have occurred to me.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: polynomial evaluation via SMul
